citeinfo.origin: University of Washington (UW), School of Oceanography
citeinfo.title: UW Aquatic Biogeochemistry Model (ABC)

abstract.p: The UW Aquatic Biogeochemistry Model (ABC) is a sub project of the Puget Sound Regional Synthesis Model (PRISM). The model was developed by a group of scientists at the University of Washington. The model contains three types of zooplankton, three types of phytoplankton, refractory and labile particulate organic matter, dissolved organic matter, and various nutrients including: oxygen, nitrate, phosphate, and ammonium. The web interface of the model allows model run as beaker or chemostat modes, as well as multi-cell.

descript.purpose: To create an aquatic model (namely plankton) in Puget Sound, Washington.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
